Detailed Description

This class implements the Extended Kalman Filter.

The system is defined by the two equations:

  • System (prediction) non-linear equation:

    with:

  • Observation (measurement) non-linear equation:

    with:

virtual void plEKF::jacob_observation_model ( plFloatMatrix &  H_k) const
protectedpure virtual

Return the partial derivative of the observation (measurement) function h with respect to evaluated using the current estimate x_current_estimation.

Parameters
[out]H_kThe Jacobian matrix to be filled. It has already the right dimension (observation dimension x state dimension)

virtual void plEKF::jacob_observation_noise ( plFloatMatrix &  V_k) const
protectedvirtual

Return the partial derivative of the observation (measurements) function h with respect to evaluated using the current estimate x_current_estimation.

Parameters
[out]V_kThe Jacobian matrix to be filled. It has already the right dimension (observation dimension x observation dimension)

The default implementation returns an identity matrix (assuming that v is an additive noise). Do not reimplement this function unless you know what you are doing.

virtual void plEKF::jacob_prediction_model ( plFloatMatrix &  A_k) const
protectedpure virtual

Return the partial derivative (Jacobian) of the system (prediction) function f with respect to evaluated using the current estimate x_current_estimation.

Parameters
[out]A_kThe Jacobian square matrix to be filled. It has already the right dimension (state dimension x state dimension)

virtual void plEKF::jacob_prediction_noise ( plFloatMatrix &  W_k) const
protectedvirtual

Return the partial derivative of the system (prediction) function f with respect to evaluated using the current estimate x_current_estimation.

Parameters
[out]W_kThe Jacobian square matrix to be filled. It has already the right dimension (state dimension x state dimension)

The default implementation returns an identity matrix (assuming that w is an additive noise). Do not reimplement this function unless you know what you are doing.
